Description: Fragment of rim of North Ionian black-glazed pottery bowl. Worn. Inside glazed, perhaps with red bands. Outside, tongues at rim; below, sphinx to left, hindquarters and part of its wing preserved. Repair hole at upper right edge of fragment.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit: 'Compare Boston 88.1031 (Faibanks pl.33, 313), from Naukratis. The bowl in Boston is about one-quarter complete and, although larger and with an interior treatment different from that of the Alexandria fragment, suggests the reconstruction of a frieze of wild goats in reserve below the incised frieze on the latter.'
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 24, no. 81 pl. 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.161)
